--- "David Tsui" <xu_dyu@c...> wrote:
> many method's return value in our project are object,
> so the problem is how to use Junit to test such method?
> and espacial most of the variable in these objects are
> "private".

I often use MockObject -- by creating a child class, with access 
to 'protected' fields -- which it exposes with get/set methods.

Another alternative:  Use Reflection.  In the Field and Method 
classes, you can set a flag to bypass protections.  Of course, you 
can't do this in a browser, and probably not in an EJB container, 
but I'm running my JUnit tests in my development environment.  And I 
have God-like authority there.  ;->
